intro: Marcgravia neurophylla, commonly known as the silver leaf vine, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety silver-green leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage. Marcgravia neurophylla thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
